benchmark_details.name: MCTS-EP (Monte Carlo Tree Search-Enhanced Preference Optimization)
benchmark_details.overview: MCTS-EP is an online learning framework that integrates large language models with Monte Carlo Tree Search for training embodied agents, emphasizing efficient preference data collection and multi-modal reasoning.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To provide an online framework that generates preference data and trains embodied agents efficiently in interactive environments.

data.source: ALFWorld and WebShop environments for benchmark testing.
data.annotation: Preference data collected from Monte Carlo Tree Search.

methodology.calculation: Success rate is calculated as the percentage of tasks completed successfully.
methodology.interpretation: A higher success rate and lower average interaction steps indicate better performance.
methodology.baseline_results: MCTS-EP achieved 92% success rate in ALFWorld and 0.81 average reward in WebShop.
methodology.validation: MCTS-EP evaluated against several state-of-the-art methods across different benchmarks.
